revised_title: Morphological Analysis of Trypanosome Strains Causing Disease in Man in Nyasaland
tldr: The authors investigate the morphology of various strains of the trypanosome causing disease in man in Nyasaland, focusing on the human strain. They analyze the average length, maximum, and minimum length of the trypanosome in different animal species and discuss the distribution of the trypanosome's length. The study aims to provide a better understanding of the classification and identification of African species of trypanosomes pathogenic to humans and domestic animals.
